intro: Malleola penangiana, commonly known as the Penang malleola, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has a woody stem with opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
